name: Powderkeg
description: Just as people are reuniting with family, friends, and crewmates, tempers are reigniting across the galaxy. Q's displacement has inflamed hostilities, old and new. Bridge the divide in the galaxy before all-out warfare erupts.
rules:
-- There are two Phases to this Event! Each Phase is individually timed.
-- In this Hybrid Event, you will complete Faction Missions in one phase, and Supply Missions in another phase.
-- Unique Dominion, Maquis, and Section 31 Faction Missions are available during the event. Open the Event to access them.
-- Using any version of Booker, Raffi, D. Troi, Graduation Amanda Grayson or Caregivers will provide a bonus to Faction Missions and Supply Missions.
-- Every Faction or Supply Mission you complete earns you Event Victory Points. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock Threshold Rewards!
-- Community Rewards are also available during Phase 2 only. Collect Event Victory Points to unlock these rewards before the phase change!
-- In this event, Squadrons may also compete to advance up the Squadron leaderboards. Join a Squadron to get more rewards!
bonus_text: Crew Bonus: Booker, Raffi, D. Troi, Graduation Amanda Grayson, or Caregivers
rewards_teaser: Reach Rank 1 by gaining Victory Points from Event Missions!

featured_crew.name: Raffi
featured_crew.flavor: Raffi attempts to reconcile with her son, Gabriel, in the hopes of making up for lost time.

featured_crew.name: Troi
featured_crew.flavor: Troi received a promotion to a full commander after passing the Bridge Officer's Test.

rewards.name: Chronitons
rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.flavor: Chronitons allow your crew to take action in these chaotic times. Use Chronitons to replay parts of past missions via the Timeline.

rewards.name: Honor
rewards.flavor: Honor is gained by dismissing crew who have served you well, but are ready for reassignment. Redeem in the Time Portal for exclusive crew, special fusion-related items, training programs, and more.

rewards.name: Voyage Revival
rewards.flavor: Use to instantly revive a failed Voyage.

rewards.name: 10x Portal
rewards.flavor: 10 valuable items. Go to Time Portal to collect!

rewards.name: Troi
rewards.flavor: Troi received a promotion to a full commander after passing the Bridge Officer's Test.

rewards.name: Rarity
rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 5 Polestars: Common, Uncommon, Rare, Super rare, Legendary

rewards.name: Skill
rewards.flavor: Contains ONE of the following 6 Polestars: Command, Diplomacy, Security, Engineering, Science, Medicine

rewards.name: ISM
rewards.flavor: ISM, or interstellar medium, is the matter that exists between astronomical objects. It can be manipulated by the Q to facilitate crew retrieval. ISM can be obtained from Daily Log-in Rewards, Campaigns and participating in Fleet activities.

rewards.name: Dilithium
rewards.flavor: Dilithium is your most valuable asset. Use Dilithium in the Time Portal to acquire valuable crew members, items, and more.

rewards.flavor: ISM, or interstellar medium, is the matter that exists between astronomical objects. It can be manipulated by the Q to facilitate crew retrieval. ISM can be obtained from Daily Log-in Rewards, Campaigns and participating in Fleet activities.

rewards.name: Dilithium
rewards.flavor: Dilithium is your most valuable asset. Use Dilithium in the Time Portal to acquire valuable crew members, items, and more.

rewards.name: Honor
rewards.flavor: Honor is gained by dismissing crew who have served you well, but are ready for reassignment. Redeem in the Time Portal for exclusive crew, special fusion-related items, training programs, and more.

rewards.name: Merits
rewards.flavor: Merits can be earned by completing missions. Use Merits to acquire faction-based rewards, upgrades to your ship, and more.

rewards.name: Training
rewards.flavor: Increases crew XP by 2500.

rewards.name: Troi
rewards.flavor: Troi received a promotion to a full commander after passing the Bridge Officer's Test.

adventures.name: Fair Trade
adventures.description: Ensure ships in other territories are returned.

adventures.name: Rules of Play
adventures.description: Establish protocols for future Q-tastrophes like this.

adventures.name: Rough Patches
adventures.description: Arrange diplomatic meetings to settle new disputes.

adventures.name: A Galaxy Set Right
adventures.description: Verify everyone has been returned with a crew roster.

rewards.name: Powderkeg
rewards.flavor: Event Victory Points

adventures.name: Rough Patches
adventures.description: Arrange diplomatic meetings to settle new disputes.

adventures.name: Idle Q
adventures.description: Find a way to occupy Q and keep him out of trouble.

adventures.name: A Galaxy Set Right
adventures.description: Verify everyone has been returned with a crew roster.

rewards.name: Powderkeg
rewards.flavor: Event Victory Points

rewards.name: Troi
rewards.flavor: Troi received a promotion to a full commander after passing the Bridge Officer's Test.

rewards.name: Raffi
rewards.flavor: Raffi attempts to reconcile with her son, Gabriel, in the hopes of making up for lost time.

rewards.name: 10x Portal
rewards.flavor: 10 valuable items. Go to Time Portal to collect!

screens.text: "Finally, another Federation ship! Listen Captain, we have a situation here. Maquis colonists and rebel fighters alike have disappeared from their homeworlds and appeared aboard ships of various factions. And they've decided to take their grievances up with anyone nearby."
"Things aren't looking much better for our relationship with the Dominion. Apparently the Founders blame 'the Solids' for this mix-up and say they're ready to impose order if we can't."

"Well, that just tracks with everything else going on today, doesn't it? We're on the verge of another Dominion War and Section 31 isn't helping matters. Operatives have been taking full advantage of the chaos to advance their own agendas."

"Ah, you humans. So quick to celebrate your peace, so ignorant to how fragile it really is. Well, Captain, you have a lot of people counting on you. What will you do? Put on a good show for me - or maybe you're just content to watch the galaxy burn."

"Finally, another Federation ship! Listen Captain, we have a situation here. Maquis colonists and rebel fighters alike have disappeared from their homeworlds and appeared aboard ships of various factions. And they've decided to take their grievances up with anyone nearby."
"Things aren't looking much better for our relationship with the Dominion. Apparently the Founders blame 'the Solids' for this mix-up and say they're ready to impose order if we can't."

"Well, that just tracks with everything else going on today, doesn't it? We're on the verge of another Dominion War and Section 31 isn't helping matters. Operatives have been taking full advantage of the chaos to advance their own agendas."

"Ah, you humans. So quick to celebrate your peace, so ignorant to how fragile it really is. Well, Captain, you have a lot of people counting on you. What will you do? Put on a good show for me - or maybe you're just content to watch the galaxy burn."

"Well, that was certainly amusing. Captain, the Federation has you running like a dog, you really should request a pay increase. ...oh, that's right, they don't actually pay you, do they? Just in warm fuzzies and replicated pseudo-food."

"The Federation has moved past the need to rely on currency in order to keep society in motion. We work hard to maintain peace, while focused on progress and exploration. You have the whole galaxy's attention, Q. What is it you really want?"

responses.text: "You criticize us, yet you're the one who relies on our strife for your petty fun."
"Hell yeah, let's do this again next month!"

screens.text: "What a sappy, canned sentiment, even for a Betazoid. What I'd like is to know is what the Captain here thought of my offering. Admit it, I brought some entertainment in to your humdrum little life, didn't I?"

"Clearly, he's the perfect example of what happens when you have too much time on your hands. Why don't you actually try to earn that command uniform you're always strutting around in, Q, and do something useful for once?"
"Yeah, no kidding. Are all the Q like this?"
"I'm not sure if you're being sincere or sarcastic, but I urge you not to provoke him. I'm still seeking several good friends, as well as Number One."

"We will come together and restore the galaxy to the way it was, by working together and setting aside our differences. You've been vital to this mission so far, Captain. Let's see it through to the end."

"Well, that was certainly amusing. Captain, the Federation has you running like a dog, you really should request a pay increase. ...oh, that's right, they don't actually pay you, do they? Just in warm fuzzies and replicated pseudo-food."

"The Federation has moved past the need to rely on currency in order to keep society in motion. We work hard to maintain peace, while focused on progress and exploration. You have the whole galaxy's attention, Q. What is it you really want?"

responses.text: "You criticize us, yet you're the one who relies on our strife for your petty fun."
"Hell yeah, let's do this again next month!"

screens.text: "What a sappy, canned sentiment, even for a Betazoid. What I'd like is to know is what the Captain here thought of my offering. Admit it, I brought some entertainment in to your humdrum little life, didn't I?"

"Clearly, he's the perfect example of what happens when you have too much time on your hands. Why don't you actually try to earn that command uniform you're always strutting around in, Q, and do something useful for once?"
"Yeah, no kidding. Are all the Q like this?"
"I'm not sure if you're being sincere or sarcastic, but I urge you not to provoke him. I'm still seeking several good friends, as well as Number One."

"We will come together and restore the galaxy to the way it was, by working together and setting aside our differences. You've been vital to this mission so far, Captain. Let's see it through to the end."
